intro.description:
Welcome to the XML Quick... tutorial of the XML-Security Plug-In.
This tutorial will show you the general usage of the quick functions. You will enter the necessary information in the preference pages to activate these functions and get an overview of all possibilities. To start this session click the 'Click to Begin' link below.
By the way, this tutorial shows only some possibilities of the XML Quick Functions. You can find more information in the extensive German online help and on the home page of the XML-Security Plug-In.

item.title: Preferences
item.description:
The first step is to provide the necessary information in your workspace preferences. You have to enter all information normally provided in the respective wizard (except passwords).
You can skip this item if you already entered this information.

item.title: Project and XML document
item.description:
Now it is time to create a new project (all your XML documents must be part of a project to work properly with the XML-Security Plug-In). It doesn't matter what type of project, the best type is of course an XML project. After that you create a new XML document with arbitrary elements, attributes and any content.
It is advisable to start with a small XML document and to extend it step by step. You can create a sample project and a sample XML document automatically by clicking on the 'Click to Perform' link below. You can skip this step ('Click to Skip' link) if you already have a project and a contained XML document.

item.title: Quick functions
item.description:
You are now ready to use a quick function. Start one by clicking on 'Quick [Signature | Verification | Encryption | Decryption]' in the context menu 'XML Security'.
All following steps depend on the selected quick function. Some functions require critical information to be entered (like a password in 'Quick Signature'), some don't and show the result directly (like 'Quick Verification').
If preferences are missing a dialog will inform you. You can then provide the missing information directly in the dialog or skip the action.
